name: Being Black on King Walking Tour
description:
From the first Underground Railroad site excavated in Canada, to one of Toronto's first soul food restaurants whose name, design and atmosphere surfaced the history of slavery in the US and Canada. Learn and celebrate the community leaders who risked everything to ensure freedom.

This tour was developed and will be led by Faith Ebanks. It is approximately 2.0 kilometers in distance and takes place predominantly on paved city sidewalks and streets. Faith is an emerging historian and art historian whose research focuses on the history of slavery and colonialism throughout the Atlantic World from the 16th to the 21st century.

name: Les Femmes Fatales - Secret Sisters
description:
They were very .... close friends.

A deep dive into queerness, femmes-ness, sapphic love and existing and hiding in plain sight under the guise of femininity and being ''best friends'', and ''roommates''. 

An unapologetic celebration of femmes being... close, femininity, sensuality, glamour and the power of red lipstick to survive, bloom and thrive.

name: Give Me Liberty Street Party
description:
Liberty Village BIA’s 19th annual street party is back!

Join us for one unforgettable evening as we celebrate everything that makes us one of Toronto’s most vibrant and creative neighbourhoods. Inspired by classic neighbourhood block parties, we are transforming into a buzzing outdoor patio. There will be live music and a DJ, a Pop-up market featuring local businesses, local food and drink, a Beer Garden with local brewers, cocktails, and lawn games.  With activities for all ages, come together to eat, dance, shop, and celebrate Liberty Village in style!

name: DOUBLE

location.name: The Citadel: Ross Centre for Dance

description:
Commissioned by Leon Arts
Choreographed by Sharon Moore

Two explorers navigate a moving landscape of identities, existences and connectivity. Through multiple performative experiments they bend their foibles and the divine, tracing back toward their point of origin – hoping to discover the hidden equation of love. This intimate and playful collaboration integrates multiple languages into an abstracted narrative; the language of the body, the spoken languages of English and Spanish, and the visual language of video design.
